unit_learning_outcomes.description: Critically synthesize and evaluate information from a variety of sources
Demonstrate advanced knowledge of the principles and concepts in one or more disciplines of Biology
Articulate clearly a coherent argument in written, oral or technical communication as relevant to the specific activity chosen
Rigorously apply scientific methods to address a biological research question

assessments.description: Supervisor and student to determine Assessment Tasks and weightings for project based units OR as listed in unit guides where components of other units are being undertaken; and approved by the unit convenor. Minimum 3 tasks required, with a maximum of 60% weighting for any one task. Tasks can vary and may include a scientific report, report, essay or exam, as appropriate for a 10cp unit.
With your supervisor develop a learning plan for the unit including assessment tasks and total time to be spent on the tasks (not to exceed 135 hrs).

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Special circumstances
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
data.description: This unit will focus on special topics in biology. Topics may range from genes to ecosystems, and focus on any level of biological organisation and any biological group or process. Topics will be chosen to encourage students to explore the different disciplines in biology and to develop skills in analysis and investigation that are necessary that are required to undertake more advanced research.
data.title: Research Topic in Biology 1
